intro: Caucaea radiata, commonly known as the golden bell vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that resemble small bells. The plant produces small, round berries that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
